description: Vetted safety and cleaning content sourced from official Vitamix materials

selfClean.title: Self-Cleaning (Official Vitamix Method)
steps: Fill the container halfway with warm water
Add a drop of dish soap
Start the machine and slowly increase to its highest speed
Run for 30-60 seconds (or use the Self-Cleaning Program if available)
Pour contents out and rinse thoroughly
Turn the container upside down and let air dry

deepClean.title: Deep Cleaning for Cloudy Containers
steps: Pour 1 cup of white vinegar into the container
Soak for several hours or overnight
Use a soft pot scrubber to remove remaining residue
Be cautious around the blade assembly - blades are sharp

alternative.title: Baking Soda Method
steps: Mix baking soda and water into a paste
Apply with a soft cloth in circular motions
Avoid abrasive tools to prevent scratching

accessories.title: Accessories Cleaning
notes: Lids, lid plugs, and tampers: wash in warm, soapy water or place on top rack of dishwasher (if model allows)
Motor base: use a soft, damp cloth to wipe clean - never submerge in water or place in dishwasher

safetyTips.tip: Use a long-handle brush when cleaning inside containers to maintain safe distance from blades

notes: Many newer containers are dishwasher-safe - consult your Owner's Manual for specifics
Blades use a hammermill design intended to pulverize rather than slice
Blades do not need to be sharpened

dedicatedContainers.title: Color-Coded Container Strategy
dedicatedContainers.officialDescription: The Vitamix Color Container is perfect for color-coded uses, like allergen-sensitive cooking and non-food blending. Feel confident avoiding cross-contamination in the kitchen.

disclaimer.text: For specific allergen safety guidance, consult your allergist or healthcare provider. Vitamix does not provide medical advice.

warranty.note: Warranty coverage varies by model. Check your specific product's warranty terms at vitamix.com or in your Owner's Manual.
